title: Chinese Embassy in Madagascar and Association of former Malagasy Students in China jointly donate medical supplies to Mahitsy Hospital
description: On August 26, 2021, the Chinese Embassy in Madagascar and the Association of Former Malagasy Students in China jointly donated medical supplies to Mahitsy Hospital.  Ambassador Guo Xiaomei attended the donation ceremony online. The donation consisted of 4 respirators, 4 oxygen concentrators, 10 forehead thermometers, 2000 masks surgical masks and 500 KN95 masks. The monetary value of the donation is unknown.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Embassy in Madagascar and Association of former Malagasy Students in China jointly donate medical supplies to Mahitsy Hospital

# Description
On August 26, 2021, the Chinese Embassy in Madagascar and the Association of Former Malagasy Students in China jointly donated medical supplies to Mahitsy Hospital.  Ambassador Guo Xiaomei attended the donation ceremony online. The donation consisted of 4 respirators, 4 oxygen concentrators, 10 forehead thermometers, 2000 masks surgical masks and 500 KN95 masks. The monetary value of the donation is unknown.
justification: Project is a medical donation with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of medical supplies to hospital, healthcare focus

title: Gansu Province provides RMB 700,000 worth of traditional Chinese medicine to Madagascar in September 2021
description: In September of 2021, the Gansu Provincial Government donated RMB 700,000 worth of traditional Chinese medicine to Madagascar. The donation included four different types of medicine targeted: one designed to boost immune systems of susceptible people; one aimed to treat mild to severe cases of COVID-19; one for serious infections; and another to help patients recover.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Gansu Province provides RMB 700,000 worth of traditional Chinese medicine to Madagascar in September 2021

# Description
In September of 2021, the Gansu Provincial Government donated RMB 700,000 worth of traditional Chinese medicine to Madagascar. The donation included four different types of medicine targeted: one designed to boost immune systems of susceptible people; one aimed to treat mild to severe cases of COVID-19; one for serious infections; and another to help patients recover.
justification: Project is a healthcare donation with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Traditional Chinese medicine donation for healthcare purposes, no energy or infrastructure components

title: Chinese Government provides anti-epidemic equipment to Madagascar in August 2021
description: On August 27, 2021, the Chinese Government donated anti-epidemic equipment to the Government of Madagascar. The equipment included dual ultraviolet disinfection carts, visual laryngoscopes and portable phlegm aspirators. The purpose of this donation is to support Madagascar’s COVID-19 response efforts. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation. China’s Ambassador to Madagascar, Guo Xiaomei, Madagascar’s Public Health Minister, Zely Arivelo, and other official members of Madagascar’s Ministry of Public Health attended the ceremony.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation. China’s Ambassador to Madagascar, Guo Xiaomei, Madagascar’s Public Health Minister, Zely Arivelo, and other official members of Madagascar’s Ministry of Public Health attended the ceremony.
justification: Project is focused on healthcare equipment donation with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Anti-epidemic equipment donation, COVID-19 response focus, healthcare sector

title: Chinese Embassy provides anti-epidemic supplies to hospitals in the Amoron'i Mania region of Madagascar in April 2021
description: On April 21, 2021, the Chinese Embassy in Madagascar donated a batch of anti-epidemic materials to hospitals in the Amoron'i Mania region of Madagascar. The materials were donated to the National Assembly of Madagascar, who will then distribute them to the hospitals. The materials donated include ventilators, oxygen concentrators, forehead thermometers, medical masks, and KN95 masks. The purpose of this donation is to support local medical staff in their COVID-19 response efforts. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  An online handover ceremony was held for this donation. Guo Xiaomei, China’s Ambassador to Malaysia, Minister Counselor Zhang Wei of the Embassy, and the Speaker of the National Assembly of Madagascar jointly attended the ceremony.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Embassy provides anti-epidemic supplies to hospitals in the Amoron'i Mania region of Madagascar in April 2021

# Description
On April 21, 2021, the Chinese Embassy in Madagascar donated a batch of anti-epidemic materials to hospitals in the Amoron'i Mania region of Madagascar. The materials were donated to the National Assembly of Madagascar, who will then distribute them to the hospitals. The materials donated include ventilators, oxygen concentrators, forehead thermometers, medical masks, and KN95 masks. The purpose of this donation is to support local medical staff in their COVID-19 response efforts. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  An online handover ceremony was held for this donation. Guo Xiaomei, China’s Ambassador to Malaysia, Minister Counselor Zhang Wei of the Embassy, and the Speaker of the National Assembly of Madagascar jointly attended the ceremony.
justification: Project is focused on healthcare support and pandemic response, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of medical supplies including ventilators, oxygen concentrators, and masks for COVID-19 response

title: ICBC London provides $66 million loan — via cross currency swap facility agreement — to Reserve Bank of Malawi to shore up foreign exchange reserves and finance the government’s current account deficit in 2021 (Linked to Project ID#98519 and ID#98521)
description: In 2021, the Reserve Bank of Malawi (RBM) — Malawi’s central bank — signed a cross currency swap facility agreement with the London Branch of the Industrial and Commercial Bank of China (ICBC London). The borrowing terms of the loan are unknown. However, the IMF has characterized RBM’s swap debt as ‘short-term’ and ‘very expensive’. The 2022 borrowing was collateralized against a $32 million cash deposit in a bank account accessible to ICBC London. The purpose of the loan was to shore up the country’s foreign exchange reserves and finance the Government of Malawi’s current account deficit. The loan’s (principal) amount outstanding was $66 million as of December 2021.  In November 2022, the IMF assessed ‘Malawi’s overall public debt […] to be in distress' and urged the Government of Malawi to scale down its ‘excessive use of short-term [swap] instruments by the RBM.’   RBM’s short-term borrowings from ICBC London in 2020 and 2022 are captured via Project ID#98519 and Project ID#98521.
staff_comments: 1. The maturity of the 2021 borrowing is unknown. However, in its audited financial statements, the RMB notes that its ‘currency swap agreements with various financial institutions […] are usually short term in nature with a maturity profile ranging between 3 months to 1 year.’ Therefore, AidData assumes for the time being that RBM’s 2021 currency swap (borrowing) agreement with ICBC London carried a 1 year maturity. This issue warrants further investigation.
combined_text:
# Sector
BANKING AND FINANCIAL SERVICES

# Title
ICBC London provides $66 million loan — via cross currency swap facility agreement — to Reserve Bank of Malawi to shore up foreign exchange reserves and finance the government’s current account deficit in 2021 (Linked to Project ID#98519 and ID#98521)

# Description
In 2021, the Reserve Bank of Malawi (RBM) — Malawi’s central bank — signed a cross currency swap facility agreement with the London Branch of the Industrial and Commercial Bank of China (ICBC London). The borrowing terms of the loan are unknown. However, the IMF has characterized RBM’s swap debt as ‘short-term’ and ‘very expensive’. The 2022 borrowing was collateralized against a $32 million cash deposit in a bank account accessible to ICBC London. The purpose of the loan was to shore up the country’s foreign exchange reserves and finance the Government of Malawi’s current account deficit. The loan’s (principal) amount outstanding was $66 million as of December 2021.  In November 2022, the IMF assessed ‘Malawi’s overall public debt […] to be in distress' and urged the Government of Malawi to scale down its ‘excessive use of short-term [swap] instruments by the RBM.’   RBM’s short-term borrowings from ICBC London in 2020 and 2022 are captured via Project ID#98519 and Project ID#98521.
justification: Project involves financial services and currency management without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Cross currency swap facility agreement, focus on foreign exchange reserves and current account deficit financing

title: Chinese Embassy donates medical supplies to government of Malawi in February 2021
description: On February 4, 2021, the handover ceremony of medical supplies donated by the Chinese Embassy to the Malawi government was held at the Malawi Ministry of Health. Ambassador Liu Hongyang and Malawi’s Minister of Health Kumbize Chiponda attended the ceremony and delivered speeches. The Deputy Minister of Health of Malawi and the Permanent Secretary also attended the event.
staff_comments: 1. Commitment date, implementation date and completion date are all estimated. Date of the handover ceremony is coded in those fields.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Embassy donates medical supplies to government of Malawi in February 2021

# Description
On February 4, 2021, the handover ceremony of medical supplies donated by the Chinese Embassy to the Malawi government was held at the Malawi Ministry of Health. Ambassador Liu Hongyang and Malawi’s Minister of Health Kumbize Chiponda attended the ceremony and delivered speeches. The Deputy Minister of Health of Malawi and the Permanent Secretary also attended the event.
justification: Project is a donation of medical supplies with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Medical supplies donation, healthcare sector focus

title: Chinese Government provides $30 million grant for Mzuzu Central Hospital Computerized Tomography (CT) Scan Room Construction Project
description: In 2021, the Chinese Government provided a $30 million grant to the Government of Malawi for the construction of a computerized tomography (CT) scan room at Mzuzu Central Hospital and other unspecified activities. The Mzuzu Central Hospital Computerised Tomography (CT) Scan Room Construction Project was completed on December 14, 2021.
staff_comments: 1. This project is also known as the China-aid CT machine room project in Mzuzu Central Hospital.
combined_text:

title: Chinese Embassy provides MWK 200 million cash grant for MWK 200 million for Sonkhwe Irrigation Project
description: On November 26, 2021, the Chinese Embassy in Malawi issued an MWK 200 million cash grant to the Lilongwe District Council. The grant proceeds were to be used by the recipient of the funds to support a community development initiative, which is part of the Sonkhwe Irrigation Project. The handover ceremony, which was held on November 26, 2021, took place at Sonkhwe Primary School.
combined_text:
# Sector
AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY, FISHING

# Title
Chinese Embassy provides MWK 200 million cash grant for MWK 200 million for Sonkhwe Irrigation Project

# Description
On November 26, 2021, the Chinese Embassy in Malawi issued an MWK 200 million cash grant to the Lilongwe District Council. The grant proceeds were to be used by the recipient of the funds to support a community development initiative, which is part of the Sonkhwe Irrigation Project. The handover ceremony, which was held on November 26, 2021, took place at Sonkhwe Primary School.
justification: Project focuses on community development through irrigation, with no clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Cash grant for community development initiative, irrigation project focused on agriculture
